summary:
Amphetamine is a medicine that helps people with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), narcolepsy, and obesity. It was first made in 1887 and used as a drug in the 1920s. Amphetamine can make people feel happier, more awake, and less hungry. It can also help them think better and react faster.

Doctors prescribe it, but it can be dangerous if used wrongly. Too much can cause problems like muscle breakdown and psychosis. It's related to other substances like MDMA and methamphetamine. Amphetamine is a strong drug that should only be used under a doctor's care.
title: Amphetamine
